intro: Oriastrum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white to yellowish flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oriastrum parviflorum is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
